frame.name: Being_necessary
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Dependent</fen> state-of-affairs has a <fen>Requirement</fen> as a prerequisite for obtaining or occurring.
<ex><fex name="req">The atomic bombings</fex> <m>were</m> probably not <t>necessary</t> <fex name="dep">to win WWII without a mainland invasion of Japan</fex>.</ex>
<ex>We will take the <t>required</t> <fex name="req">measures</fex>, regardless of the yelping of the left. <fex name="dep">DNI</fex></ex>
<ex> <fex name="reqe">Two tokens</fex> <m>are</m> <t>necessary</t> <fex name="Dependent">for county to county trips</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Dependent
FE.definition: <def-root>The state-of-affairs which cannot hold without the <fen>Requirement</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Requirement
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity or state-of-affairs that must be present or obtain in order for the <fen>Dependent</fen> to obtain.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Dependent</fen> depends on the presence of the <fen>Requirement</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which the <fen>Requirement</fen> is necessary for the <fen>Dependent</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Condition
FE.definition:
<def-root>The conditions under which the the <fen>Requirement</fen> is necessary.
<ex>Such care is <t>necessary</t> <fex name="Condition">if you operate under martial law</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition:
<def-root>The field of endeavor whose nature imposes the <fen>Requirement</fen>.
<ex>Unfortunately, such tactics appear to be <fex name="dom">politically</fex> <t>necessary</t> nowadays.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Place</fen> denotes a location in which the specified relation between <fen>Requirement</fen> and <fen>Dependent</fen> holds.
<ex><fex name="pla">In the US</fex>, the political clout of big city mayors is <t>necessary</t> to put this on the national agenda.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Dependent_individual
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual who needs to have the <fen>Required_entity</fen> or for the <fen>Requirement</fen> state of affairs to obtain.
<ex> We ask you to obtain for us all that is <t>necessary</t> <fex name="dep">for us</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Required_entity
FE.definition: <def-root>An entity that has to be present for the <fen>Dependent</fen> state of affairs to obtain.</def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>An characteristic or feature of the <fen>Requirement</fen> or <fen>Required_entity</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the <fen>Explanation</fen> causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: necessary.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: required to be done, achieved, or present; needed.

lexUnit.name: requirement.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an entity or situation which is required

lexUnit.name: necessity.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the state or fact of being necessary.
